document.masterDocTitle: On the taxonomy of the Barsine delineata species-complex (Lepidoptera, Erebidae, Arctiinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: On the taxonomy of the Barsine delineata species-complex (Lepidoptera, Erebidae, Arctiinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Hypoprepia
?
delineata Walker, 1854
, List of the specimens of lepidopterous insects in the collection of the British Museum 2 : 487 (Type locality: "Shanghai, N. China").

=
Ammatho figuratus Walker, 1855
, List of the specimens of lepidopterous insects in the collection of the British Museum 3 : 759 ( Type locality: "North China "), syn. rev.

=
Cyme chinensis C. Felder & R. Felder, 1862
, Wiener entomologische Monatschrift 6 : 36 ( Type locality: "Ning-po"), syn. rev.

=
Ammatho fuscescens Butler, 1877
, Transactions of the Entomological Society of London 1877 : 343 (Type locality: "Mongolia and Shanghai"), syn. rev.

=
Miltochrista dimidiata Fang, 1991
, Sinozoologia 8 : 389, 395, fig. 4 (Type locality: China, Hunan), syn. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Taxonomic notes . Hampson (1900) listed
Ammatho figuratus Walker
,
Cyme chinensis C. Felder & R. Felder
and
Hypocrita rhodina Herrich-Schäffer
as synonyms of
delineata
. The type specimens of the first two taxa described from China have no morphological differences compared to
delineata
( Figs 1–3 ), and the synonymy of
delineata
,
figuratus
and
chinensis
is confirmed here. The type specimen of
Hypocrita rhodina
is not examined, but the taxon was described from Borneo where
B. delineata
does not occur, but another externally similar species,
Barsine exclusa Butler, 1877
is distributed. Thus,
Hypocrita rhodina
is presumably conspecific with
B. exclusa
, but this question will be solved only after the examination and dissection of the type specimen of
rhodina .
The dark form of
Barsine delineata
has a dark form which strongly differs externally from the typical form, and was described as
Ammatho fuscescens Butler
( Fig. 5 ). Subsequently,
A. fuscescens
was treated as a synonym ( Hampson 1900 ), form ( Reich 1937 ), and aberration (
Daniel 1951; as 'ab. fuscens '
) of
B . delineata
. Later, the same dark form of
B. delineata
was described by Fang (1991) as a distinct species
Miltochrista dimidiata Fang
( Fig. 6 ), which was transferred to
Barsine
by
Dubatolov et al. (2012)
. Nevertheless, the male and female genitalia of this form ( Figs 10 , 14 ) equal to those of the typical form ( Figs 9 , 13 ). Thus here the new synonymy is established:
B. delineata Walker
=
Miltochrista dimidiata Fang
,
syn. n.
, and the synonymy of
B. delineata
and
Ammatho fuscescens Butler
is revised.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis . Externally a highly variable species, ground color varies from brownish red and orange brown to brownish black; forewing pattern consist of diffuse blackish brown transverse lines and longitudinal strokes in the submarginal area; the dark form have the ground color of forewing blackish, with only small orange brown fields in subbasal and antemedial areas. The male genitalia are very characteristic and readily separated from those of the other described
Barsine
species by the following characters: (1) the valva is very broad; medial costal extension is triangular, narrow; distal costal extension a broad lobe with curved and strongly dentate crest at dorsal margin; (2) the sacculus is broad, setose, with a short, slightly curved and apically blunt distal extension; (3) the aedeagus is long and narrow, the vesica with several small conical membranous diverticuli, one medio-lateral broad sack-like and one dorsal finger-like diverticuli with numerous small spine-like cornuti. In the female genitalia, the postvaginal plate is broad, band-like; ductus bursae is triangular, moderately sclerotized, with broad antrum; corpus bursae is ovate, with numerous small spinules in posterior section; appendix bursae is conical, membranous and laterally positioned.
